definition: variant of 殺一儆百|杀一儆百[sha1 yi1 jing3 bai3]
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to alert/to warn/police
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. to kill a chicken in front of a monkey; fig. to make an example of sb (by punishment) to frighten others
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
lit. punish one, warn one hundred (idiom)/fig. to make an example of sb
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
lit. killing the chicken to scare the monkey (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to punish severely
guilty of terrible crimes (idiom)/reprehensible
law and order/rules and discipline
to rebel against the emperor (idiom)
lit. to punish a little to prevent a lot (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent large scale repetition
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
lit. if he orders you go, he forbids you stop (idiom); fig. to demand exact compliance with instructions/to ensure strictly obedience
